content:
Q: How do I make a claim?
A: You can submit the claim form, along with the supporting documents by fax at 6224 1923 or email at claims@hlas.com.sg. Alternatively, you can post it to HL Assurance office at 11 Keppel Road #11-01 ABI Plaza Singapore 089057.
questions: What are the acceptable methods for submitting a claim form and supporting documents, and what contact details correspond to each method?
If a claimant prefers to submit their claim by post, what is the full mailing address they should use?
Can a claim be submitted via email, and if so, what is the exact email address provided?
Is fax submission of claims allowed, and what is the fax number to send the documents to?
What types of documents must accompany the claim form when making a submission?
Are there any specified formats or file types required for electronic submission of supporting documents via email or fax?
Does the policy specify any time frame within which claims must be submitted after the insured event?
Are there any instructions about the completeness or verification of supporting documents when submitting a claim?
If a claimant sends their claim form and documents by post, is there any indication of whether original documents or copies are required?
Does the policy mention any preferred or mandatory language for the claim form and supporting documents?
Are there any guidelines on how to handle sensitive personal information when submitting claims via email or fax?
Is there any mention of a claim reference number or confirmation process after submission by any of the methods?
Does the policy specify whether claims submitted via one method (e.g., fax) can be supplemented later by another method (e.g., email or post)?
Are there any instructions regarding the use of courier services or registered mail when posting claim documents?
Does the policy provide any contact details for inquiries or assistance during the claim submission process?
Are there any exclusions or conditions that affect the validity of claims based on the method of submission?
Is there any indication that claims submitted after a certain deadline or by an incorrect method might be rejected?
Does the policy require any specific forms or templates to be used when submitting claims, or can any written format be accepted?
Are there any instructions about submitting claims for multiple insured persons or family members under the same policy?
Does the policy mention any consequences or delays associated with incomplete or improperly submitted claims?
